DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication whether or not any AEs were experienced during the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Adverse Event Yes No Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._An indication of whether an adverse event has occurred.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether an adverse event has occurred.

Concepts.definition: An indication of whether an adverse event has occurred.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Prompt
ReferenceDocuments.description: Adverse Events

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

ReferenceDocuments.name: N/A
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable.  The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Were any adverse events exper
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were any adverse events experienced?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Indicate if the subject experienced any adverse events. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience any reportable adverse events during this reporting  period?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced a neurotoxicity during this period?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience any unacceptable toxicities as defined in the protocol (section 9.3.4.2) during this reporting period?
